EVEN amongst savage nations, virtue has its re- ward. Though almost ignorant that they are men, they delight in honourable titles. The Abipones do not account that the best nobility which is inherited as a patrimony‚ but that which is obtained by their own merits. Amongst them, as no one is distinguished by his father's name, in like manner no one is ennobled by the famousdeeds of his father, grandfather, or great grandfather. The nobility of valour and pro- bity, not that of birth, is what they prize and honour. By a kind of natural propensity they respect the sons and grandsons of their Caciques and Captains; yet if they be stupid, cowardly, of unpleasant manners, or a foolish understand- ing, they make them of no account, and never prefer them to the government of the horde, or os military expeditioris.
